The Senior Manager of Data Science – Policy & Advocacy provides strategic guidance and insight for departmental and legislative opportunities through the use of data analysis and fact-based argumentation. The individual will create value by identifying appropriate data and applying comprehensive statistical modeling to create analysis and insights that will be used to support policy positions and identify implications for the business. The incumbent will build off of current models while also developing new analysis and models. The insights derived from this analysis will be used to inform stakeholders. The individual will partner with a team to provide clear analytical impacts that enhance or provide new insights for advocacy materials.

Position Responsibilities

Through robust statistical modeling, analyze and articulate the impact of taxation and other legislation that impacts the business.
Assist in developing new insights and analysis on the impact of proposed legislation and regulation – for the business and the appropriate governmental entity.
Contribute to the development of short-term and long-term strategies around the Company’s legislative initiatives.
Identify and lead statistical analysis of data and databases to develop compelling arguments.
Provide analysis and insights to advance Tobacco Harm Reduction and advocacy materials.
Partner with key cross-functional stakeholders to inform and assess impact of policies.
Assist in leading research efforts of various economic and political issues that guide policy to enable the company to identify issues and trends in advance to be pro-active rather than reactive in defending the business.
Monitor policy, legislative and advocacy activity to anticipate issues impacting the industry and the Company.
Fact check statements made and materials produced by external governmental entities and NGOs (such as state budget documents), tobacco control and our competitors.
Contribute to continued evaluation of the effectiveness of analysis and advocacy materials to enhance future efforts.

Genesis Research is an international healthcare consultancy providing end-to-end value evidence strategy, development, and communication services to Life Sciences companies. We are looking for an individual with demonstrated leadership, biopharma industry experience, and strong methodological skills to lead a growing team epidemiologists and RWE scientists. Our RWE-S team has seen exceptional growth and success in providing holistic and comprehensive support to Life Science organizations. The professional leading this team must possess and demonstrate a passion for innovative research, maintain accountability for all RWE deliverables, develop RWE scientists and research teams. This person must understand the needs of clients’ internal and external stakeholders and leverage this understanding to suggest and design value-added, fit-for-purpose research approaches. This role reports to the Chief Scientific Officer. Location: Hoboken, NJ, USA, although remote locations may be considered. Local and international travel of up to 20% is required.


Accountabilities within this role:
• Be the Genesis Research Authority on study design, methodology, and result interpretation for all RWE Deliverables
• Lead, manage, and ensure maximum utilization of a team of epidemiologists and health services researchers charged with designing, implementing, and managing a wide range of studies assess the distribution, patterns and determinants of health and disease conditions and examine access to and the use, costs, quality, delivery, organization, and outcomes of health care.
• Create, update, and maintain Methodological and Scientific Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) that RWE teams will follow
• Support Client Managers with execution and delivery of high-priority and highvisibility studies as a Client-facing subject matter expert
• Provide training, oversight, and guidance for new and current members of the Epidemiology team
• Ensure that the Epidemiology team members are aware of and understand RWD data sources, their strengths and limitations, and statistical software when designing studies
• Manage team capacity in concert with Client Management needs
• Motivate teams during periods of high demand

Qualifications:
▪ Master’s degree, MD or PhD within a relevant discipline (Epidemiology, Public Health, Statistics)
▪ 10+ years of consulting, industry, or academic experience
▪ Experience generating and interpreting real-world and observational research required
▪ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
▪ Proficiency in relevant software such as MS office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and statistical packages
▪ Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail
▪ Enthusiasm to learn and motivation to develop oneself and others within Genesis Research
▪ Flexibility to adapt to client project needs in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial workplace
